intro: Diemisa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy diemisa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. Diemisa pubescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
